meanings.definition: The act of adding color to something.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy colouring in my coloring book.
meanings.sent2: The children were busy colouring their drawings with crayons.
meanings.sent3: She tried colouring her hair with markers, but it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: His vibrant personality was like a beautiful colouring on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The artist's precise colouring brought the picture to life.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is colored or the combination of colors used.
meanings.sent1: The colouring of the sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The colouring of the flowers in the garden was vibrant and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The unusual colouring of the cat made it look like a tiny tiger.
meanings.sent4: The colouring of the rainbow was like nature's own masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Her unique colouring style made her paintings stand out.

meanings.definition: A substance used to add color to something.
meanings.sent1: She bought new colouring for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed different colourings to create the perfect shade.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally used the wrong colouring in the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with its warm colouring.
meanings.sent5: The colouring spilled on the table, creating a messy but artistic pattern.
